title: Cyclones add size on defense
text:
Cyclones add size on defense 
Updated: Wed, Oct 21 2015, 11:38 AM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- The Cincinnati Cyclones (1-0-0-0) have signed free agent defenseman Dax Lauwers for the 2015-2016 season. Lauwers made his professional hockey debut with the Colorado Eagles last season.A native of Anchorage, AK, Lauwers appeared in nine games for the Eagles at the end of last season upon graduation from Northeastern University. He didn't register a point in Colorado, however he did account for 16 penalty minutes and an even on-ice rating.The 6'2", 210-pound rearguard skated in 106 games during his three-year career at Northeastern, accounting for a pair of goals and nine assists. Lauwers also spent a season at the U.S. Military Academy (Army), where he totaled a goal and two assists in 33 games played. Image and information courtesy Cincinnati Cyclones Related Stories Entertainment News
